monogr.title: “Tu sei sacerdote in eterno”: Festschrift per Paolo Garuti

biblStruct.note: Ps 110,3 is, beyond any reasonable doubt, one of the most text-critically challenging verses of the Psalter. Almost every generation of Christian and Jewish commentators has been puzzled by the enigmatic syntax and imagery reflected in the Hebrew text. In this paper, I will try to offer new insights into one of the most intriguing choices of the Syriac Peshitta translator – namely, the translation of the Hebrew «dew» (טַל) with the Syriac noun «child» (ܛܠܝܐ).
